title: 106_s1435
content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. The Small Business Administration Act is amended to include a new subsection on Volunteer Mentoring Programs, defining terms like 'eligible association' and 'qualified mentoring organization'. The Administrator may award grants to eligible associations in areas with low SBIR awards to assist small businesses in completing the programs. Eligible associations must submit applications for the grant. The amount of assistance granted will be determined by the Administration. The grant amount for eligible associations ranges from $50,000 to $200,000. Recipients can reapply for additional grants to support mentoring programs. Funds must be used for technical assistance provided by mentoring organizations. The grant funds support mentoring programs for small businesses in low participation areas, providing guidance through SBIR and STTR program processes. Qualified mentoring organizations can be reimbursed for out-of-pocket expenses incurred while providing services. Qualified mentoring organizations can be reimbursed for travel and communication expenses incurred while employees are away from their regular places of business. Employees are deemed Federal employees while carrying out activities under the grant program. Employees participating in the grant program are considered Federal employees for tort claims and compensation purposes, with benefits calculated based on a GS-11 salary. Authorization of appropriations for a grade GS-11 employee is set at $1,000,000 annually. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must issue final regulations within 180 days and submit a report on maximum grant amounts within 18 months. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must issue final regulations within 180 days and submit a report on recommendations for changing the maximum grant amount under section 9(u)(4) of the Small Business Act.
